New Records: Francisco Lindor launched the longest home run of the game with a 398-foot blast
Key Match Events: Francisco Lindor hit a game-turning home run in the ninth inning to end a no-hitter threat and ignite a six-run inning
The Mets staged an epic rally from three outs away from being no-hit, eventually winning 6-2
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets had struggled with their offense, only securing two extra-base hits in the series prior to the ninth inning
Manager Carlos Mendoza emphasized the importance of finding ways to win despite the team's offensive challenges
Post-Match Reflections: Francisco Lindor expressed pride in the team's resilience and the significance of the win on a day honoring first responders
Manager Carlos Mendoza highlighted the victory as a pivotal moment in their playoff push
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game marked the fifth time in franchise history the Mets won after being no-hit through eight innings
The Mets' six runs in the ninth inning were the most by a team without hits through eight frames in the expansion era
